Package org.jtrim2.event

Interface EventDispatcher<EventListenerType,ArgType>

Type Parameters:
EventListenerType - the type of the listeners whose event handler method is to be invoked by the onEvent method
ArgType - the type of the argument to be passed to the onEvent method. Since event handlers typically does not have more than one argument, this can be the same type as the one passed to the actual event handler method. In case, the event handler does not need any kind of arguments, this type is recommended to be the type Void.
public interface EventDispatcher<EventListenerType,ArgType>
Defines an interface to invoke specific kinds of event handlers.

This interface is used as a generic wrapper for all kinds of events, so that ListenerManager can invoke them. They should do little more than invoking the event handler method of the listener with the appropriate arguments.

The onEvent method accepts an arbitrary argument, therefore it is enough to define a single EventDispatcher instance for each kind of event handler method. So it is recommended, to define a single static EventDispatcher instance for every such methods for better performance.

Thread safety

Implementations should maintain the thread-safety property of the event handler method they notify.

Synchronization transparency

Implementations should maintain the synchronization transparency property of the event handler method they notify.
See Also:

    onEvent(EventListenerType eventListener, ArgType arg)

  • Method Details

    • onEvent

      void onEvent(EventListenerType eventListener, ArgType arg)
      Invokes the event handler method of the specified listener with the appropriate arguments. The event handler must be called synchronously on the current calling thread.

      An argument can be specified for the event to be dispatched. This argument is typically the same argument as the one required by the event listener.

      Parameters:
      eventListener - the listener whose event handler method is to be called by this method. This argument cannot be null.
      arg - an argument for the current event to be dispatched. The exact meaning of this argument depends on the event handler to be invoked. This argument may be null, if the listeners supports null arguments.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - implementations may choose to throw this exception if the specified listener is null
